The victor marries the vanquished and, after child production, the male undergoes surgery to prevent further sperm production. The parasite consumes part of the material passing through the orifice. Once the original orifice has been completely replaced, the parasite creates urges to pass more material through the respective orifice by releasing hormones directly into the hosts bloodstream. The canal is capable of folding itself back into the infested orifice, like a flower or anenome, to prevent discovery. I hate parasites in the real world, but as a fantasy they are really hot.<br><br> Parasitic relationships are defined as a stable relationship where one organism benefits while the other organism loses. This is in contrast to symbiotic behavior where both organisms benefit. Parasites are only appealing when combined with the concept of 'inflicted pleasure', the concept of being pleasured against your will. This idea come up a lot of porn, because it's awesome to get what you want without having to work for it and everyone writing porn knows that. A parasite which pleasures you as it's 'ill effect' is, in fact, actually being symbiotic and this may be why parasite porn is plagued with terrible storylines, because to the intelligent writer it's not actually parasitic unless it's hurting you but if it's hurting you it's not attractive.<br><br> Therefore it seems reasonable to say that nobody actually enjoys //parasite// porn, but rather //symbiote// porn that disguises itself as parasitism. It's similar to how some 'submissive' people don't actually want to be submissive, they just want to have things they like forced upon them without any guilt attached.<br><br> A lot of mechanical features of parasites have been altered for this game. Parasites like to use long, spindly body parts for injection or to allow for insertion into other organisms. Long spindly body parts are horrific - no seriously, they are just disgusting. The organisms in this game are 'chibified' versions of real life parasites. Mouths are smaller or nonexistant, limbs are shortened and fat. They have been made cute, but in the process they no longer are scientifically valid parasitic lifeforms. I think that's just fine. Personally every time I see some kind of hyper-realistic parasite in porn I just ask why - why would you find that hot?<br><br> Many people use sexual attraction in a parasitic way. The victim needs to be //in the mind of the parasite// to experience it's pleasure. I guess this is one way empathy can hurt you. However, you do have to access and //listen// to the ships operating manual rather than reading it. It is horribly slow. You end up having to learn some kind of advanced variant of FORTRAN in order to give it the appropriate command syntax. After much effort and banging your head against the wall, you realize that the ship actually has a wormhole stabilizer on board.<br><br> You tell the ship to open up a portal to the last known destination. The last destination happens to be the Antari Research Facility, 3000 lightyears away - still on our side of the Milky Way and not very far in cosmological distances but still much farther than any human has ever gone. At least, anyone you've ever heard of.<br><br> The facility is on a desolate frigid wasteland world. Fertile worlds are scarce in the universe, so every single one that gets discovered is marked for colonization. In order to maintain privacy, the Antari needed to put their secret government research labs on worlds that could not sustain large populations.<br><br> You open the portal and stare through the aperture. After infesting the female’s neck and planting a Werm inside her brain, she is commanded to release the prisoners. You are met with a blank stare from the infested victim. Once again, and with more force, you command her to open the cells. Nothing, just the empty eyes of the infested. It then occurs to you that Antari generally don’t speak English, and this scientist probably didn’t have any sort of translator. You gesture to the cells and pantomime their doors opening. With a directive she can understand, she immediately complies, heading to a nearby console.<br><br> ''The prisoners have been released.''<br><br> You look around – your companions have dealt with the remaining scientists. <br><br> [[Continue->Genetics Laboratory]] <<elseif $breedassault == 2>> A direct assault of this place, basically a prison, could go wrong in so many ways. One choker seizes the prisoner, and the other waits by the entrance. Each prisoner is so dazed and heavily infested that the choker takes their minds almost immediately. The drugged and newly-infested prisoners cannot overpower the scientists on their own, but it serves as enough of a distraction for the choker in waiting to wrap around the scientist’s neck from behind and tap into their brain.<br><br> Once all the scientists are infested, you summon them. You think for a moment. More infested bodies will help, and you’ve already converted a number of perfectly good breeder prisoners. No reason not to bring them along. Turning to the nearest scientist, you tell her to open the cells. You are met with a blank stare. Once again, and with more force, you command her to open the cells. Nothing, just the empty eyes of the infested. It then occurs to you that Antari generally don’t speak English, and this scientist probably didn’t have any sort of translator. A closer look at the project summaries betrays the true purpose of the facility. This is a biological weapons factory to be used by Antari against their own kind. The weapon in question, to your surprise, is the Werm Program. A relatively new development, the Werm is a biological superweapon in its beta-testing phase. Though Earth is not explicitly mentioned, the files describe “test planets” which the Werm was to be unleashed upon to study its efficacy. Upon completion of the test runs, all evidence of the bioweapon was purged from the planet’s surface. Until you.<br><br> Further reading sheds light on the motivation behind such a dangerous and powerful creation the Werm represent. There are evidently thirty-five “core worlds” in the Antari Empire, a vast polity given the rarity of habitable planets. These core worlds are mostly located around mature planets in the outer arms of the Milky Way. Keeping the most distant core worlds tied together with the heart of Antari space is a logistical nightmare that even the dominant intelligence in our galaxy can scarcely manage. Political strife of all kinds, usually derived from conflicting interpretations of interstellar law, is the norm in these outer worlds. Such conflict has repeatedly flared up in the past, provoking multiple brutal civil wars within Antari space, the most recent of which was especially sanguinary.<br><br> Like any other Antari rebellion, the insurgents destroyed or otherwise sabotaged the portal network, protecting them from immediate retribution, buying them time to organize. The punitive response fleet had to travel conventionally, but the expected minor battle between the Imperial Fleet and the rebel-controlled Planetary Defense Grid never happened. Antari leadership was intent on making a permanent example of these malcontents.<br><br> Staying out of weapons range, the Imperial Fleet instead deployed a planetary weapon of mass destruction. They dispersed a layer of dust in a ring around the local star, between it and the planet. Sunlight faded to a hellish twilight at its brightest. This “Dust Siege” quickly led to complete ecosystem failure and societal collapse from the resultant lack of food and power. People slaughtered each other in droves. Imperial command broadcast the madness to other core worlds; a grim reminder of the price of stepping out of line.<br><br> The Antari are not without a sense of morality, even up in the highest military echelons. The ones perpetrating the atrocity were also horrified by it, and they sought alternative means of quenching rebellions. Apocalyptic weapons like black hole generators and thermonuclear bombardment were not viable. Habitable planets are too valuable to extinguish or render unlivable. Viral attacks were explored, but a virus is virtually impossible to control, as runaway mutations and zoonotic transfers to local wildlife often caused similar habitability issues. A breakthrough was made by engineering a large, multicellular organism from scratch to propagate in a viral matter; as a parasite. The vastly-slower pace of evolution and mutation of multicellular life seemed a natural fit – fearsome offensive capability combined with the comparative ease of disposal of the parasites after pacification is achieved.<br><br> Further reading brings you into the layout of the entire facility. There are 4 main structures/departments, arranged in a line.<br> ''Logistics Center'' - Your current location. Houses personnel on-site in the short term and houses the all-important off-world portal, allowing transit of people, goods, and services at such a pace that more or less can hold Antari society together. Personnel do not typically stay at the facility due to the ease of travel, but in case of portal failure, supplies are stockpiled for short-term habitation.<br> ''Breeding Center'' - The next building down the line. Antari criminals are kept here against their will to serve as Werm breeders. Ethically indefensible, but secretly condoned by shadowy elements of Imperial Command as necessary, given their tenuous political situation.<br> ''Genetics Laboratory'' - A facility full of bioincubators, which house new and experimental forms of weaponized parasites.<br> ''Werm Pit'' - Little more than a giant pit to hold all the stockpiled and newly-birthed Werm specimens. At the center of the pit lies a suppression device that uses some form of magnetic resonance to pacify the Werms and keep them from escaping the pit. At least, it used to be. It's been cleaned up, mostly from internal pressure as the backstabbing and degeneracy got so bad even the criminal element of Antari society was unable to bear it any longer. Although maintenance is clearly not their priority, the underground halls of the black market are mostly clean with very few vermin scurrying about. A paramilitary police force keeps vendors in check and prevents dangerous altercations from breaking out.<br><br> /*<<room_system 'infestation' _passage>><br>*/ The history of Antari technological superiority began with the discovery of neutron lattice manipulation. Before that, all computers relied on atoms as the smallest unit of volume. Arranging neutrons and protons into stable logic gates gave rise to the possibility of reducing computer size by a further 99%. However, the density was roughly on par with a neutron star, and any practical logic system would collapse in upon itself. This issue was solved with the discovery of the euboson, an exotic arrangement of quarks that created a negative graviational field. By arranging a lattice of neutrons and eubosons, protons were used as a signal particle to create the first calculator smaller than an atom. An interpreter read the altered electrical field from the calculator to display the result of operations. Technology with smaller-than-atom computing was named 'Pantech', but sounded horrible to everyone so colloquially it is known as 'Dynotech'.<br><br> This breakthrough led to the dominance of Antari technology and culture in the galaxy for several reasons. The first and foremost was that Antari tech became superior by several orders of magnitude, but equally as important was the fact that it couldn't be reverse engineered. Only a handful of civilizations were near the point of being able to understand this new strata of computer technology and they were the first to be attacked by the new Antari weapons of war.<br><br> However, Antari dominance of the galaxy has clearly been deemed a small price to pay for the new level of luxury that everyone seems to be living in. Medical nanobots, general AI, mind uploading, personal supercomputers - these are some of the many benefits shared in this new age.<br><br> <<set _p = 'adminbmarket'>> <<if _infected_antari >= 10000>> [[Ionic Pulse Frequency Grenade->PulseGrenade]]<br> - Antari bio weapon used to stun organic creatures. It works by causing neurons and nerve cells to randomly and violently discharge action potentials. Causes neural networks to behave strangely. Loss of consciousness, time dilation, and flashes of light are all standard effects of this grenade. The effect spreads roughly 3 meters out with a logarithmic dropoff of efficacy beyond that point. It was used successfully to suppress dense riots right after being invented, but once the abysmally small effective radius was well known it stopped being a useful tool for the police. It is now only used in very specific circumstances.<br><br> <<else>><font color = grey>Ionic Pulse Frequency Grenade unlocked at 10000 infected Antari</font><br><br> <<endif>> <<if _infested_antari >= 10000>> [[Universal Translator->Translator]]<br> - Exactly what it sounds like. The solar roads have no specular reflection despite their mineral composition, and stand in dark contrast to the well-lit buildings in the city. Most of the city space is dedicated to transportation infrastructure. The Antari despise traffic with a burning passion. The buildings are mostly made of carbon fiber composites as a way of sequestering carbon to prevent climate change. Antari construction uses so much dense carbon it is actually carbon negative, offsetting the clearcutting in the surrounding farming region. As a result, the Antari have no restrictions on building development and have a glorious sprawling city center with domes, blocks, and spires creating an intricate and diverse skyline.<br><br> The core world of Seneton pulls vast amounts of resources and luxury goods from fringe worlds and experiences very little unrest. Antari are born with both male and female genatalia, and through competition their gender gets assigned at some point after puberty. All Antari have breasts, a penis, and a vagina. Antari females are simply male Antari that have been penetrated after losing a fight. The physical change occurs rapidly after an Antari male ejaculates into the womb. The Arena Of Destiny was the conventional accepted method for allowing Antari to compete and transition. At first it was a private affair, usually sending two Antari friends in to a secluded arena and waiting to see who emerged victorious. The pair was then married on the spot and declared off-limits to others. However, unscrupulous individuals would still sometimes attack codified Antari couples, so chastity belts were commonplace in the earliest centuries. If you go faster and faster, to a stationary outside observer your time starts to slow down. That's because they are seeing slower and slower snapshots of the light bouncing off of you. To you, time is moving normally, but you'll see THEM as being slowed down because of the same exact effect in reverse. Once you get close to lightspeed, they will practically be frozen in time. This assembly of structures is how the town is connected to the greater Antari network - both on this world and others.<br><br> The flight pads are located in a central area, allowing spacecraft and aircraft to land and taxi into the surrounding terminals. The terminals themselves are filled with high security portals of varying sizes. The energy cost of opening and maintaining portal traffic makes it unfeasible for most civilian use. Instead, most Antari use magnetic rail for terrestrial travel. Magnetic railways and isolated roads lead into the terminals from all directions. Most payment and bureaucracy is automated, and the timings of train, air, and space travel are coordinated such that it typically only takes three minutes to leave a train and get on a connecting flight.<br><br> The terrestrial shipping flights use vehicles that - strangely enough - resemble giant Twinkies in their shape and consistency. A soft malleable outer layer of self repairing foam gives these machines a certain robustness when it comes to small accidents and mishaps, which is key to operating in a dense technological jungle. The flight mechanism does not use wings, instead relying on lighter than air beads. The beads are made of an exotic material, very strong and very thing, that encapsulates a vacuum. These beads begin to float skyward at sea level although lose their effectiveness in thin atmospheres. They are packed densly into the rooftops of the flying vehicles, and only a small amount of thrust is required to move around once airborne. These vehicles can achieve massive cargo ratios with relatively low manufacturing and energy costs, but are limited in speed.<br><br> For most travel that does not involve portals, saucers are used. The construction of saucers was made possible by the discovery of the fourth spacial dimension, which allowed the Antari to create volumetric thrust fields. In a normal aircraft, the thrust is a two dimensional plane (typically at the back of the aircraft) which pushes on the engine, which then translates its forward motion to the rest of the vehicle. This creates acceleration differentials - parts of the vehicle will be accelerating differently than other parts. The 4d engine, however, creates a three dimensional volumetric thrust across the entire ship at the same time. When the saucer slows down, everything within the saucer slows at exactly the same speed. This system of acceleration prevents the crew from feeling G-forces even when accelerating from perfectly still to the speed of sound within a second. The only limitation becomes the structural integrity of the metals used in the construction of such saucers and their aerodynamic stability.<br><br> There have been a number of terrorist incidents in the Cephalome - once a flaming train full of explosives was sent straight through a portal into the northern terminal. It wasn't the worst terrorist act committed - the worst accident ever recorded was a portal opening up into the middle of a star, vaporizing the core of an entire city. Since then, safeguards and multilayer handshake protections have been put in place which has prevented any major accident from occuring for the last 50 years.<br><br> Portal technology has also been miniaturized to apertures as small as 1 inch across. This tech has medical, entertainment, and military applications. A portal 'ring' can be built around a shoulder or hip joint to instantly replace a limb with a limb from another Antari also wearing portal tech. This method of portal use is much faster and more responsive than opening massive Antari-sized openings through space and can be used to give a robotic pilot an Antari head, and if the vehicle gets blown up or shot down the portal is simply truncated and the pilot's head returns to their body at a base miles away.<br><br> [[Ask about faster than light travel->FTL]]<br><br> /*Open a portal back home, bring your old body*/ <<if is_pc('sapphire')>> <<if $game.flags.portal_home>> [[Stand before the portal that lead back to home->Portal To Earth]]<br> <<else>> [[Open a portal back home->Portal To Earth][$game.flags.portal_home = true]]<br> <</if>> <</if>> <<if (is_pc('pc') || ($game.entities.cur_identity == $game.entities.orig_identity)) && $game.flags.portal_home>> [[You stand before the portal that can finally take you back home->Portal To Earth]]<br> <</if>> <div id="MenuContainer"> <ul id="navigation"> @ [[Arena]] @ Portal Hub @ [[Hospital->P4 Hospital]] @ [[Black Market->Antari Black Market]] @ [[Neighborhood->Neighborhood]] </ul> </div><font size = 4>''=Acquiring Ionic Pulse Grenade=''</font><br><br> "You there, what do you know about mind uploading?" <</link>> </span>Walkthroughs: [[Part 1->Walkthrough CH1]] [[Part 2->Walkthrough CH2]]<br> /*[[Info]]*/Chapter 1<br> Spaceship<br> <ol> <li>After the introduction, tranform into an Antari using the Surgery screen in the starting room, this lets you interact with the alien crew</li> <ul> <li>Get a choker on your neck and wait until it fully assimilates</li> <li>"Accidentally" infest your neck with a werm in the masturbation menu (however, this prevents you from being mindfucked by NPC's)</li> <li>The werm's thoughts start to merge with your own</li> </ul> <li>Go to the Science Lab across the hall to the right and open the captains notebook, this gives you the door code for later</li> <li>Go back to the left until you find Rene, the blonde, and infect/infest her</li> <li>Explore the bottom part of the ship until you find Joan, the redhead, and infect/infest him</li> <ul> <li>If you have a choker on your neck, and it has merged with you, and there is no werm in your choker, you can get mindfucked by joan repeatedly to access a bad end</li> </ul> <li>Infiltrate the Bridge on the right side of the ship and infest Sarah, the captain</li> <li>Infest the captain with a choker parasite and a werm parasite in her neck to take control of her brain</li> <li>After the captain's brain is infested, you can "warp speed ahead" to pilot the ship to a distant space station</li> <ul> <li>Alternatively, go to the bottom right room and try to launch the escape pod</li> <li>Find the battery (left most room in the ship) and the flight computer(top left room) and take them back to the escape pod</li> <li>Launch the escape pod and head home</li> </ul> </ol> Key Saychu Space Station <ol> <li>Get inside the machine in the Medical Bay (first room above where you enter the ring), which puts choker eggs inside any infested holes</li> <ul> <li>Use it repeatedly to access a bad end</li> </ul> <li>Infest the Antari in the rooms around the space station</li> <li>Infest the scientist in the lab to get starfish breast parasites (requires a choker and werm in your inventory for her to appear)</li> <li>Infest the secretary (in the room below the scientist, top right) by having a choker and werm in your inventory. Get the key.</li> <li>With the key from the secretary, Get to the High Security Storage (two rooms below the secretary) and open the Large Refrigerated Crate</li> </ol>Chapter 2<br> <<chapter_walkthrough 2>><<set _host = gethost($game.variables.biosuit_mutate.host)>> <<set _old_suit = window.parasites[$game.variables.biosuit_mutate.old_suit].mature.parasite>> <<set _new_suit = window.parasites[$game.variables.biosuit_mutate.new_suit].mature.parasite>> The <<=_new_suit.name>> feels a lot more flexible and soft than before starting the process. Wearing the <<=_new_suit.name>> atop of the <<=_old_suit.name>> feels like wearing tight fitting clothes and quite soon that feeling dissolved. It's like an actual skin to the touch. <br> [[Continue->$return]]<font size = 4>''=Brain Infestation: Conclusion=''</font><br><br> <<set _p = gethost($id)>> <<set _para_choice = $temp.color>> <<set _para_type = (_para_choice=="cyan")?"werm":_para_choice+"_werm">> <<set _werm = parasite_retrieve($people.pc, _para_type)>> <<infest _p "neck" _werm>> <<set _werm_info = parasite_info(_para_type)>> <<set _br_arousal_peak = $game.variables.br_arousal_peak>> <<call _p>> has had their brain infested by a _werm_info.name, which has now taken over their body. It whispers relentlessly in their mind.<br><br> <<set _p_total = _p.braininfest.state.total.npc>> <<set _par_total = _p.braininfest.state.total.werm>> <<if _p_total >= _br_arousal_peak>> <<call _p>> accepts the brain infestation, allowing it free access to their mind. They give in to the parasite completely, becoming a perverse, obedient vessel. <br> <font class="posprompt">''-10 to discovery score''</font><br> <font class="negprompt">''<<call _p>> perversion is now 100''</font><br> <font class="negprompt">''<<call _p>> resistance is now -100''</font><br> <<set $game.busted_meter-=10>> <<set _p.stats.base.perversion = 100>> <<set _p.stats.base.resistance = -100>> <<else>> <<call _p>> tries their best to reject the werm brain infestation. They are not strong enough to retain control over their body, but their free will is making it difficult for the werm to maintain control. Their behavior will be erratic, and probably draw attention. <br> <font class="negprompt">''+10 to discovery score''</font><br> <font class="negprompt">''+30 to Resistance''</font><br> <<set $game.busted_meter+=10>> <<set _p.stats.base.resistance += 30>> <</if>> <<if _par_total >= _br_arousal_peak>> The _werm_info.name is pleased with how the infestation process has gone. It was able to make all the necessary connections with little to no problems. It's ability to control the subjects behavior has been enhanced, making it easier to avoid detection. <br> <font class="posprompt">''-10 to discovery score''</font><br> <<set $game.busted_meter-=10>> <<else>> The _werm_info.name has had a difficult time with the brain infestation process. Out of frustration, it has spent some time altering the subjects sexual preferences to align with its own. As a result, it has less control over their behavior in general and will probably attract more attention during normal behavior.<br> <font class="negprompt">''<<call _p>>'s preference were altered to the _werm_info.name preferences''</font><br> <font class="negprompt">''+10 to discovery score''</font><br> <<mind_infestation 'alter' $id 'werm' $temp.color>> <<set $game.busted_meter+=10>> <</if>> <font color="yellow">''<<call _p>>'s neck orifice can now no longer be inseminated''</font><br><br> [[Continue->$return]] <<if $game.busted_meter < 0>> <<set $game.busted_meter*=0>> <<elseif $game.busted_meter > 100>> <<set $game.busted_meter = 100>> <</if>> <<unset $scene_flags.induced>> <<unset $scene_flags.altered>> <<unset $scene_flags.rising>> <<unset $scene_flags.cur>> <<set $people[$id].ai.behavior = 'subvert'>><<switch $temp.color>> <<case "cyan">> <<default>> <div style="display:inline-block;position: relative;z-index: 0;width:100%;float:left;zoom:0.5"> It is estimated that every year approximately 1 million people are killed by P. falciparum, especially in Africa where this species predominates. P. falciparum can cause severe malaria because it multiples rapidly in the blood, and can thus cause severe blood loss (anemia). In addition, the infected parasites can clog small blood vessels. When this occurs in the brain, cerebral malaria results, a complication that can be fatal.<br> Plasmodium vivax, which is found mostly in Asia, Latin America, and in some parts of Africa. Because of the population densities especially in Asia it is probably the most prevalent human malaria parasite. P. vivax (as well as P. ovale) has dormant liver stages ("hypnozoites") that can activate and invade the blood ("relapse") several months or years after the infecting mosquito bite.<br> Plasmodium ovale is found mostly in Africa (especially West Africa) and the islands of the western Pacific. It is biologically and morphologically very similar to P. vivax. However, differently from P. vivax, it can infect individuals who are negative for the Duffy blood group, which is the case for many residents of sub-Saharan Africa. This explains the greater prevalence of P. ovale (rather than P. vivax ) in most of Africa.<br> Plasmodium malariae, found worldwide, is the only human malaria parasite species that has a quartan cycle (three-day cycle). (The three other species have a tertian, two-day cycle.) If untreated, P. malariae causes a long-lasting, chronic infection that in some cases can last a lifetime. In some chronically infected patients P. malariae can cause serious complications such as the nephrotic syndrome.<br> Plasmodium knowlesi is found throughout Southeast Asia as a natural pathogen of long-tailed and pig-tailed macaques. It has recently been shown to be a significant cause of zoonotic malaria in that region, particularly in Malaysia. P. knowlesi has a 24-hour replication cycle and so can rapidly progress from an uncomplicated to a severe infection; fatal cases have been reported." - US Center for Disease Control<br><br> [img[$image_dir+"other/cells2.png"]]<br><br> Malaria has been with the human race for its entire evolutionary existence, and has been said to have killed one out of every two humans that ever existed. While that number can't be definitivly proven, malaria has historically dwarfed all other infectious diseases in terms of human death. If that assumption is anywhere close to reality, it is mind boggling.<br><br> Imagine all the people that have died from hurricanes. Floods. Cancer. Heart disease. The casualties of every war that ever happened. Home accident deaths. Suicides. Fire. Earthquakes. Murders. Drownings. Famine. Malaria has been as bad as all of those //combined//.<br><br> Some forms of malaria can be completely cured, while others have a dormant state in the liver. Curing malaria has waxed and waned over the past decades - new cures have been discovered, only to have the parasite gain immunity to those cures. Treatment in developed nations usually consists of using several different drugs to attack the parasite simultaneously. Malaria mortality rate in the developed world dropped severely after World War 2 and the litany of technological advances birthed from that conflict. Up until then, it was one of the largest killers of humans.<br><br> [img[$image_dir+"other/land05.jpg"]]<br><br> The worst impacts of malaria are currently sequestered to Africa. Political instability and a heavy mosquito population make the disease very difficult to control over there. However, just because malaria is currently not an issue in developed countries doesn't mean it has been cured. Because of their complexity, parasites have greater ability to evolve drug resistances and maintain those resistances than bacteria or viruses. ''The malaria parasite has evolved resistances to several anti-malarial drugs already and may become resistant to multilayer treatments in the future.''<br><br> [[Back->Bathroom]]<br> <<audio "background" stop>> <<audio "dream" loop play volume .4>> <<include "Audio Options">><font size = 4>''=Sex is the parasite=''</font><br><br> You are alive - and this is reality. This is it. The alpha and omega - everything that you experience happens between the goalposts of your birth and death. Anything you know about the past or the future is information stored in a living computer that exists in the now.<br><br> This is it. And if you are smart, you've figured out that when you breed, when you have offspring, that marks an end to part of your life. It's an endless cycle with no alternative.<br><br> Everyone who resists it dies. Everyone who accepts it dies. The cycle continues, unabated. The paradox of intelligence rears its head - even if you figure out whats going on, can you come up with an alternative? So far, of the billions who have inhabited this planet, the answer has been no.<br><br> Sex gnaws at us. We wish to build monuments, to ride through the sky, to construct intricate mechanisms and to bask in the warm simple sun. Sex penetrates the mind. It says "go". Breed. Do it. Procreate. Everyone is told this over and over, day in and day out. It's necessary for the continuation of the species. It's nobody's fault - and yet still so often we want to blame someone. Something.<br><br> Isn't there a better way? Maybe you can find it.<br><br> [[Back->Lower Bathroom]]<br> <<audio "homemusic" stop>> <<audio "dream" loop volume 0.2 play>> <<include "Audio Options">><font size = 4>''=Schistosomiasis=''</font><br><br> A neglected tropical disease, Schistosomiasis is caused by a parasitic fluke. Also known as Bilharzia, the disease is mostly a product of the eggs these worms produce. They get lodged in the human body and cause inflammation or scarring. Chronic infections mean chronic inflammation, and poor development of the host. If untreated, the infection can last for years.<br><br> Praziquantel is used to effectively treat every form of this disease within 1-2 days. Even so, it is estimated that 200+ million people are infected by this disease, mostly in Africa and Asia. Roughly 200,000 people die every year from Schistosomiasis. These deaths are a product of political instability and poor development - the science is available but the material wealth is lacking.<br><br> Schistosoma mansoni - Africa, the Middle East, the Caribbean, Brazil, Venezuela and Suriname<br><br> S. haematobium - Africa and the Middle East<br><br> S. japonicum - China, the Philippines, Indonesia and Southeast Asia<br><br> <<back>> <<audio "homemusic" stop>> <<audio "dream" loop volume 0.2 play>> <<include "Audio Options">><font size = 4>''=Toxoplasma Gondii=''</font><br><br> Toxoplasmosis is a parasitic disease caused by Toxoplasma gondii. Infections with toxoplasmosis usually cause no obvious symptoms in adults. Occasionally there may be a few weeks or months of mild flu-like illness such as muscle aches and tender lymph nodes. In a small number of people, eye problems may develop. In those with a weak immune system, severe symptoms such as seizures and poor coordination may occur. If infected during pregnancy, a condition known as congenital toxoplasmosis may affect the child.<br><br> [img[$image_dir+"other/cells1.png"]]<br><br> For women of childbearing age, a survey of 99 studies within 44 countries found the areas of highest prevalence are within Latin America (about 50–80%), parts of Eastern and Central Europe (about 20–60%), the Middle East (about 30–50%), parts of Southeast Asia (about 20–60%), and parts of Africa (about 20–55%). The US has a roughly 7% infection rate.<br><br> There are three types of Toxoplasma parasite:<br> Type I: virulent in mice and humans, seen in AIDS patients.<br> Type II: non-virulent in mice, virulent in humans (mostly Europe and North America), seen in AIDS patients.<br> Type III: non-virulent in mice, virulent mainly in animals but seen to a lesser degree in humans as well.<br><br> Infection by T Gondii causes rats to change their behavior, becoming more attracted to cats and thus easier to prey on. They become extremely attracted to the smell of cats. It is postulated that this parasite also affects human disposition toward cats. There are many cases of toxoplasma apparently causing schizophrenia, dementia, and other neurological disorders. It has been linked to "crazy cat lady" syndrome. Heavy Toxoplasma infection is also thought to partially cause higher levels of violence and aggression in a given region.<br><br> Trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole is used to prevent infection, but once infection occurs there is no cure. However - ELQ-300, an experimental drug against malaria, has shown some effect on the toxoplasma parasite post-infection. Toxoplasmosis only causes about 750 deaths per year in the US, compared to 400-4000 cases of infection. About half of the deaths are from eating toxoplasma contaminated food, making it one of the leading causes of food poisoning deaths. Once infected, it doesn't do much until the immune system starts to degrade.<br><br> [[Continue->Upstairs Bathroom]]<br> <<audio "homemusic" stop>> <<audio "dream" loop volume 0.2 play>> <<include
